Name: Bovine with tied legs
Description: This wooden model, which was acquired by an exchange with the Museum of Cairo, was part of a larger group representing a butcher's scene. It is a young bovine, sculptured in medium high relief. Above the eye, indicated by a black point and a white circle, one notices a small hole in which a horn must have been placed. The object, which symbolically assures the necessary provisions for survival in the Afterlife, dates from the Middle Kingdom.
